info.title: Calendros API Documentation
info.description: API documentation for Calendros - A comprehensive calendar management system

post.description: Create a new user account and return authentication token

message.example: The email has already been taken.

post.description: Authenticate user and return token (revokes previous tokens for single-device login)

get.description: Retrieve the currently authenticated user's information
Get all calendars owned by the authenticated user, ordered by default status and name

post.description: Create a new calendar for the authenticated user

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific calendar (must be owned by authenticated user)

put.description: Update an existing calendar (must be owned by authenticated user)

delete.description: Delete a calendar (must be owned by authenticated user). All associated events will also be deleted.

get.description: Get all events for a specific calendar with optional date range filtering

parameters.name: filter[start_time][gte]
parameters.description: Filter events starting from this date (ISO 8601 format)

parameters.name: filter[end_time][lte]
parameters.description: Filter events ending before this date (ISO 8601 format)

post.description: Create a new event in a specific calendar

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific event including calendar and invites

delete.description: Delete an event. All associated invites will also be deleted.

get.description: Get all invites for an event (event owner only)

post.description: Send an invitation to a user for an event (event owner only). Queues an email notification.

get.description: Get all event invites for the authenticated user

post.description: Accept an event invitation. Only the invitee can accept.
Reject an event invitation. Only the invitee can reject.

delete.description: Delete an event invitation (event owner only)
